#labels Featured
= Installation =

Installing and Configuring the Jaspersoft !BigQuery Connector

= Summary =
  # Sign up for !BigQuery
  # Download Jaspersoft !BigQuery connector
  # Deploy Jaspersoft !BigQuery connector to iReport
  # Create a !BigQuery connection/data source in iReport
  # Create a report
  # Deploy the query executor report
  # Deploy the report to !JasperReports Server
  # Run the report

= Details =

==*1. Sign up for !BigQuery*==
See [https://code.google.com/p/jaspersoft-bigquery-datasource/wiki/SignUpforBigQueryService Sign up for BigQuery] for details.

Note:
Existing !BigQuery users may skip 'Sign up for !BigQuery Service' section in the above link but are adviced to refer to 'Generate API Access ID' subsection for instructions on the properties needed for Jaspersoft-!BigQuery Datasource connection.

==*2. Download Jaspersoft !BigQuery connector*==
Download the following files from the project [https://code.google.com/p/jaspersoft-bigquery-datasource/].The following files are included:
  * jrs-bigquery-X.X.X
  * Jaspersoft-iReport-!BigQueryPlugin-X.X.X
  * js-bigquery-datasource-X.X.X

==*3. Deploy Jaspersoft !BigQuery connector*==
 See [https://code.google.com/p/jaspersoft-bigquery-datasource/wiki/JaspersoftBigQueryConnectoriniReport Jaspersoft BigQuery Connector Deployment in iReport] for details.

==*4. Create a iReport*==
 See [https://code.google.com/p/jaspersoft-bigquery-datasource/wiki/CreateiReport Create a iReport] for details.

==*6. Deploy the connector to !JasperReports Server*==
  * Unzip [https://code.google.com/p/jaspersoft-bigquery-datasource/downloads/detail?name=jrs-bigquery-0.0.2.zip jrs-bigquery-0.0.2.zip]
  * Copy the unzipped files files into .../webapps/jasperserver-pro/WEB-INF/
  * Be sure to keep the folder structure when copying the files.
  * Start or restart !JasperReports Server to apply the changes.

==*7. Deploy the report to !JasperReports Server*==
===*Data Source*===
  * Define the data source in !JasperReports Server
  * Right-click a folder, add a Data Source
  * Set the Data Source properties   
===*Report*===
Use either the !JasperReports Server web interface or the iReport   Repository Navigator to deploy the report.

Deploying the report to !JasperReports Server from iReport:
  * In the !JasperReports Server Repository Window, create a new server
  * Set the configuration properties for the server. Default organization name is organization_1
  * Include the report to be deployed and click on publish.
Deploying the report to !JasperReports Server using the web interface
  * Login as a admin
  * Right click on the Data Sources under Repository->Folders and select Add Resource->Data Source
  * Set the properties for the Data Source
==*8. Run the report*==
Search for the report or browse to the report in the !JasperReports Server repository.
